result.execSummary:
The defendant John H. Harnisch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John H. Harnisch is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John H. Harnisch was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • John H. Harnisch was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to 21CM1119.
No sentence credit given.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
May not have contact with victim or her place of emplyment, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John H. Harnisch

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge - Cts 2 & 3

08:31 AM
Defendant John H. Harnisch appeared with Attorney Donald Bielski.  Defendant in custody.
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 2-Crim Dam to Property & Ct 3-Crim Trespass to Dwelling, both w/Domestic Abuse; found guilty by the court.
Ct 1 was dismissed outright on State's motion.
Cts 2 & 3:
Court orders withheld sentence; 
Defendant placed on probation for 12 months w/conditions;
To run consecutive to 21CM1119.
No sentence credit given.
Court costs ordered; no restitution requested.
Submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
No contact with victim or her place of employment.
Appeal rights given.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.  
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Danielle B.

01:04 PM   Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Don Bielski.   The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Case was assigned to Br. 3.  A new tab has been pulled and the case is now assigned to Br. 4 pursuant to court rule.   Plea of Not Guilty entered. Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.. $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). rb
